Basic details: Emily Johnson, a 5-month-old girl, is brought to the ED by her parents due to multiple episodes of diarrhoea.
Vitals:
BP: 70/40 mm Hg
Temp: 100.4°F (38°C)
RR: 40/minute
HR: 150/minute
Physical presentation:
Lie in the crib appearing lethargic and irritable.
Have sunken eyes and a dry mouth.
Cry without tears.
If oral rehydration is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What is oral rehydration?”
Challenging question: “Is my baby going to be okay? Does she need to be admitted to the hospital?”
